page.title: 01A View from Mynydd Machen
page.content: Our D-Block covers a mountainous area between the Ebbw & Rhymney valleys. There are two major villages-Crosskeys in Ebbw valley & Machen in Rhymney.Be- tween lies Mynydd Machen(362m).Towards the S.E. edge of the Ebbw side is the northern end of Risca village. We were a mining area(all pits now are worked out)and there are a number of disused quarries.Another major feature is Crosskeys College- Wales's first tertiary college. The area is heavily forested with con- ifer & deciduous with rough grazing for sheep.Other features are the pre- dominance of religion-18 chapels-and the Club/Institutes(9 in all)both of which reflect the community life which in 1985 is fast changing.People of the area now travel away to work in other pits or other industries.Even so the unemployment rate is over 20%.{
